summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to personnel at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), arranging for the delivery of a replacement hard drive for Ghislaine Maxwell after she broke her previous one. The email includes instructions to provide Maxwell with the new drive and to return the broken one.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email; a detainee at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) who broke a hard drive and is being sent a replacement.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, coordinating the delivery of a replacement hard drive to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC and requesting the return of the broken drive.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY
persons.context: The intended recipient for the return mailing of the broken hard drive from the MDC.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is corresponding with detention center staff regarding logistical matters (hard drive replacement) for the defendant, Maxwell.

events.title: Replacement Drive Sent to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends a replacement hard drive via FedEx to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC, to replace one she recently dropped and broke.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) as of December 2020.
Maxwell broke a hard drive while in detention, necessitating a replacement from the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The correspondence shows logistical coordination between the prosecution and detention officials regarding Maxwell's access to case materials or evidence.
The email is dated December 4, 2020, during the pre-trial phase of Maxwell's federal criminal case.
